CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1952, p. 1, reads: "Belmar Shrine - Because of a vision which he had, Mauro Palumbo of the East End, built a shrine on the site of Belmar Gardens. Hundreds of persons are visiting the shrine to pray and seek relief for their ills. The shrine is shown above with a boy at prayer.  Also (inset) a sign with arrow pointing to way to the shrine. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Boy wearing baseball uniform, kneeling and praying in front of shrine with religious statues and vases of flowers, outdoors near Belmar Gardens, Homewood
